description: Indicates that interfering Radio Signal was detected or no longer detected
When the interference is detected it may prevent reliable operation of BS.
If this occurs continuously investigation to locate source of interferer
is required.
Default severity: Major.

Summary.eval: ($v4 ne '') ? '$v4' : (($v2 == 0) ? 'Carrier sense interference cleared' : 'Carrier sense interference detected')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseStatus i 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseCountStatus c 9999 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseTrapInfo s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Indicates whether interference is detected based on the the level threshold
and count limit. Each change of this status will trigger trap sending.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseStatus

description: Indicates the number of detections of interference withing the period defined
by asdmaxCarrierSenseMonitorPeriod.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseCountStatus

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised.
e.g. 'Interfering Carrier Detected'
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseTrapInfo

description: Raised to indicate that BS changed the carrier frequency to avoid
the interference.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised.
e.g. 'Interfering Carrier Threshold Exceeded Carrier Frequency
changed from xMhz to yMhz'
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseFreqChangeTrapInfo

description: Trap Signifies that BS has lost/recovered timing lock with external (GPS)
timing source. If lock lost the BS will cease to transmit depending
on setting the of asdmaxTimingSourceControl.
Default severity: Critical.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Indicates current status of timing frame lock.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmax1ppsFrameLockStatus

description: Indicates presence of external 1pps clock
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmax1ppsClockDetected

description: OBSAI link between SDR and SCRT link carry signalling and data traffic
has failed. If problem persists check optical cable connection.
Default severity: Critical.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxObsaiLinkTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxObsaiLinkStatus i 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxObsaiLinkStatusInfo s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Indicates the current state of the OBSAI links to the SCRTS as
seen by the SDR.
The trap can only be raised after a time of 60 seconds has elapsed after
power up/reset of BS to allow for startup process.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxObsaiLinkStatus

description: Provide additional textual information as in following examples:
'OBSAI links Failed=None'
'OBSAI links Failed=Link0'
'OBSAI links Failed=Link0,Link1'
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxObsaiLinkStatusInfo

description: Signifies that BS transmitter has bee disabled due to detection of a fault
indicated by ScrtRfTransceiverStatus object.
Default Severity : Critical.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Reports current status of RF Transceiver.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfTransceiverFaultStatus

description: Indicates the problem in text. Where practical multiple faults
can be indicated by a comma separated list e.g.:
- SCRT(n) Initialisation error; e.g. Device driver hardware fault detected
- SCRT(n) Calibration fault; e.g. missing Tx or Rx Cal tables
- SCRT(n) PA Over-current detected
- Tx switched off via MIB
- SCRT(n) Unable to determine Board Type Frequency Variant
- Tx disabled due to Timing Loss (Lock from GPS lost)
Where n is the instance number of SCRT (0,1,...).
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfTransceiverFaultStatusInfo

description: BS shall send this trap each time any of the critical to NMS operation
status parameters changes: SW version, IP and MAC addresses of SS itself
WiFi AP and EasyVoice.

event.Summary: NMS operation status parameters changed: [SW version: $v3, IP address: $v5, MAC address: $v1, WiFi IP address: $v7, WiFi MAC address: $v8, EasyVoice IP address: $v10, EasyVoice MAC address: $v11]

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusChangedTrap AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsTrapStatusSsMacAddress s EXAMPL AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusHwRevision i 9999 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusSwVersion s EXAMPLE AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusIpAddrType i 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusIpAddr s EXAMPLE AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusWiFiApIpAddrType i 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusWiFiApIpAddress s EXAMPLE AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusWiFiApMacAddress s EXAMPL AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusEasyVoiceIpAddrType i 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusEasyVoiceIpAddress s EXAMPLE AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusEasyVoiceMacAddress s EXAMPL

description: SS MAC address defintion used as atrap object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsTrapStatusSsMacAddress

description: SS Hardware revision reported using custom TLV type 2 of REG-RSP.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusHwRevision

description: SW version SS is currently running, reported using custom TLV type 3 of REG-RSP.
BS shall send a trap asMaxBsSocReportedSsStatusChanged on each change
in the value of this object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusSwVersion

description: The type of address reported in the asdmaxSsStatusIpAddr object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusIpAddrType

description: IP address of the SS obtained dynamically during DHCP/TFTP phase
of NetEntry. BS can obtain this address using two methods: DHCP snooping/proxing
or from reports coming from SS. Both methods should update this field.
Both empty string and 0xFFFFFFFF will be treated as if address is unknown.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusIpAddr

description: The type of InetAddress used by asMaxBsSocSsWiFiApIpAddress. Typically it refers to IPv4
but is defined in fully flexible way to satisfy SNMP MIB guidelines.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusWiFiApIpAddrType

description: IP address of SS integrated WiFi AP,
reported using custom TLV type 2.5 of CNFG-RSP.
When address hasn't been reported yet the object shall read 0xFFFFFFFF.
BS shall send a trap asMaxBsSocReportedSsStatusChanged on each change
in the value of this object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusWiFiApIpAddress

description: MAC Address of SS integrated WiFi AP,
reported using custom TLV type 2.7 of CNFG-RSP.
When address hasn't been reported yet the object shall read FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
BS shall send a trap asMaxBsSocReportedSsStatusChanged on each change
in the value of this object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusWiFiApMacAddress

description: The type of InetAddress used by asMaxBsSocSsEasyVoiceIpAddress. Typically it refers to IPv4
but is defined in fully flexible way to satisfy SNMP MIB guidelines.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusEasyVoiceIpAddrType

description: IP address of SS integrated EasyVoice product (residential VoIP gateway),
reported using custom TLV type 2.6 of CNFG-RSP.
When address hasn't been reported yet the object shall read 0xFFFFFFFF.
BS shall send a trap asMaxBsSocReportedSsStatusChanged on each change
in the value of this object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusEasyVoiceIpAddress

description: MAC Address of SS integrated EasyVoice product (residential VoIP gateway),
reported using custom TLV type 2.8 of CNFG-RSP.
When address hasn't been reported yet the object shall read FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
BS shall send a trap asMaxBsSocReportedSsStatusChanged on each change
in the value of this object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsStatusEasyVoiceMacAddress

description: Trap to be sent by BS when an event is received from SS via TLV.
SS MAC address defintion used as atrap object.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsTrapStatusSsMacAddress

description: An event sent by SS to BS. BS should send trap asMaxBsSocSsEventTrap
containing the definition of SS event.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxSsTrapStatusSsEvent

description: Trap sent to indicate a chane of the licence certification validity state.
i.e. sent when the invalid certificate was first decoded (alarm raise)
and when valid certificate replaced invalid one (clear).

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 0) ? 'Licence certificate is invalid' : 'Licence certificate is valid'

description: Reports the invalidity of the configured certificate asdmaxLicenceCertificate.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxLicenceCertInvalid

description: Indicates that interfering Radio Signal was frequently detected (high interference),
infrequently detected (low interference) or not detected at all.
When the interference is detected it may prevent reliable operation of BS.
If this occurs continuously investigation to locate source of interferer
is required.
Default severity: Major for frequent detection and Minor for infrequent detection.
A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Combined status of carrier sense interference detection for all SCRT instances.
Individual instances status is defined in asdmaxScrtStatusCarrierSense.
Each change of this status will trigger trap sending.
When one SCRT reports highInterference and the other lowInterference
the resulting combined status is highInterference.
The details about insances are available in asdmaxCarrierSenseTrapInfo.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseStatusV2

description: Implementation specific free text description of the trap raised.
e.g. 'Interfering Carrier Detected'
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxCarrierSenseTrapInfo

description: Reports the change of the combined status of available RF paths
(physically associated with SCRTs).
Used to generate alarm in NMS.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatusChangeTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatus i 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatusBits b 0 AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatusInfo s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Reports overall status of RF paths. Used to test for alarm condition.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatus

description: Detailed information about nature of reported issue in RF paths.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatusBits

description: Provide additional textual information as in following examples:
'RF paths Failed=None'
'RF paths Failed=Path0'
'RF paths Failed=Path0, Path1'
It may provide other useful hint.
variables.name: AIRSPAN-DEMOMAX-MIB::asdmaxRfPathStatusInfo
